history.content:
Dear Students,

Please consider nominating deserving students for this year's Student Awards. Nominations are due by midnight on Friday, March 2. You may submit nominations through the Student Awards website. You will need the student's email address to submit a nomination. For more detailed information check out Piazza post @6221


Submit a Nomination: https://buffy.eecs.berkeley.edu/PHP/awardapp/menu.php?dept=eecs

Physiologic Informatics Research Opportunity at UCSF: Students and Recent Grads

Join a team of physicians and engineers developing clinical decision support tools to reduce preventable deaths caused by sepsis and patient discharge errors. This NIH funded project involves predictive analysis of EHR (electronic health record) data through machine learning. Students interested in a long-term, self-directed research opportunity in preparation for medical or graduate school, or for an undergraduate thesis, are encouraged to apply for Fall 2017. We also have full-time opportunities, effective immediately, for recent graduates, such as those taking a gap year prior to graduate or medical school.


We have clinical, regulatory, statistical algorithm development, programming, and peer-review manuscript writing opportunities available. Students must be able to make a substantial commitment to this position during the fall and spring semesters and work full-time on this project throughout the summer. Recent graduates must be able to work full time for a minimum of 6 months.


If this sounds interesting, apply here (this takes less than 10 minutes!): https://phys-inf.typeform.com/to/zh9Yd9. We will be accepting applications until the positions are filled, so apply early!


For further information, please email Prof. Chris Barton (chris.barton@emergency.ucsf.edu).

TEDxBerkeley: "You are Here"

On February 17, 2018 TEDxBerkeley is gathering world-leading thinkers, makers, and doers at UC Berkeley to discuss our theme “You are Here.” Check out the lineup of speakers and entertainers we have for you this year on our website: tedxberkeley.org.

 

As an exclusive code, please use SPECIAL15 for a 15% discount!

 

Event: Saturday, February 17th

CEGA at UC Berkeley is hiring a spring intern!

http://cega.berkeley.edu/opportunities/bitss-intern-spring-2018/


CEGA seeks a motivated student intern to work closely with the Berkeley Initiative for Transparency in the Social Sciences (BITSS) team. This is an opportunity for a graduate student or third or fourth year undergraduate to work on a short-term project (1-2 months) during the 2018 Spring semester. CEGA is able to offer a small stipend for this position.


Responsibilities

  • Reorganize BITSS website (BITSS.org) so that it is more intuitive to navigate, user-friendly, and engaging, making various small fixes in backend code. This may include making the website mobile device-friendly.

  • Advise BITSS on website security protocols and best practices. This may include creating automated mechanisms for website backup and updating.

  • Present on project at a CEGA staff meeting.


Desired Qualifications

  • Junior, Senior, or Graduate student studying Computer Science, Web Design, or other relevant field.

  • Website CSS programming.

  • Experience with website security, managing underlying SQL database, SSH/SFTP, and ability to reliably backup website data.

  • Excellent oral communication skills.

  • Well-organized, with strong attention to detail.

  • Self-directed, intrinsically motivated; proven capacity to manage work independently.

  • Sense of humor with a positive attitude in approaching challenges and uncertainty.


How to Apply

Send a cover letter and resume to BITSS Snr. Program Associate Katie Hoeberling at khoeberling@berkeley.edu with the subject "BITSS Intern – Spring 2018". Please detail any previous experience with website development, design, or security.

Entrepreneurship and Innovation in Europe, Portugal

Join Entrepreneurship and Innovation in Europe, Portugal for an intensive, fast-paced learning experience, where you will learn from venture capitalists, serial entrepreneurs, executives from Silicon Valley companies, and experts from across the globe.

Berkeley students spend the first week in Porto, Portugal for a series of challenges, leadership training, and team formation built on the foundations of the Berkeley Method of Entrepreneurship. Afterwards, you will travel to Cascais to collaborate with over 60 mentors and 400 students from all over the world.


Don't miss your chance to hear from highly successful entrepreneurs and gain invaluable insight into starting your own company. Whether you’re a seasoned student entrepreneur or have barely heard of Silicon Valley, this program gives you an incredible opportunity to explore your passion and potential within the startup scene and the world of business.


*The program is English so there is no language prerequisite.

*Undergraduate and Graduate Students from All Majors accepted.


Program Dates: July 8th – August 4th, 2018


For details visit: http://scet.berkeley.edu/summer-abroad/

*Applications opens February 1st and closes March 9th.

*Space is limited and applications are accepted on a first-come, first-served basis.


*To apply visit - http://studyabroad.berkeley.edu/program/summerabroad/portugal

For questions Contact - d.vivo@berkley.edu


Info Session - Thursday, February 22nd - 6 pm @  the SCET offices in the Memorial Stadium.

RSVP at the Facebook Event

Build the Future DeCal

Curious about startups and entrepreneurship? Enroll in Build the Future (CS198) to listen to prominent founders, VCs, and faculty members come in to speak about their ventures and how to get started on building out ideas. Previous speakers include Steve Wozniak, Tesla founder Marc Tarpenning, venture capitalist Vinod Khosla, and more.


This semester, we're planning on also curating private dinners with many of our speakers. Class will be held on Thursdays from 6:30 - 8PM and it’s perfect for any student curious about startups.


More info + apply for Decal: www.thefuture.build


News coverage:

http://news.berkeley.edu/2017/09/29/in-berkeleys-new-undergrad-startup-class-students-learn-to-build-the-future

http://www.sfexaminer.com/best-silicon-valley-class-money-cant-buy/

https://engineering.berkeley.edu/2017/03/origin-stories-house

SF Hacks Invites UC Berkeley

SF Hacks is San Francisco State University’s free 24-hour collegiate hackathon. Come network, create, and compete for a variety of prizes! SF Hacks will provide you food, energy drinks, and support to make your projects come true.


Sign up today on our website!

Sfhacks.io

$1,500 Autolist Scholarship for Berkeley EECS

Autolist's team hails from locations across the globe and from varied socioeconomic backgrounds, but we are united by a common thread: a college education. A college degree has never been more critical but college costs continue to increase, and Autolist feels supporting students in this endeavor has never been more important.


Towards that goal we are offering a quarterly $1,500 scholarship for outstanding students on either on a merit or need basis. In either case, the application consists of two essays and some additional questions.


Here is a link to our scholarship with more detailed information: https://www.autolist.com/used-car-to-dream-car-scholarship.


The next deadline for the scholarship is March 1, 2018 so we would love it if this scholarship could be posted as soon as possible!


Our rolling deadline dates are:

March 1

June 1

September 1

December 1


Paige Johnson, ​847-650-1307

Research Assistant: R/Matlab expert for Sahel precipitation trends analysis

We are looking for a research assistant with excellent Matlab and/or R skills to work on data-driven analyses of environmental systems. We use machine learning and other big data methods to understand relationships between climate, hydrology and land cover in the West African Sahel.


The project investigates changes in the seasonality of rainfall in the West African Sahel. We use traditional data analysis techniques alongside neural network-based self-organizing maps. Data sets include both satellite and ground-based observational precipitation products.

The research assistant will aid in the development and application of big data methods to environmental data sets. The work will include data acquisition, pre-processing, and management; development and implementation of data processing pipelines; and exploratory data analysis. Advanced experience with programming required, R/Matlab preferred. Ideal candidate will be able to commit at least 8 hours per week. Paid position. Contact Mollie Van Gordon, mvangordon@berkeley.edu, for more information.

Bio-Tech Connect: Networking with Industry

Thursday, Feb. 22, 3:30 - 6:00 PM

Stanley Hall Atrium


Bio-Tech Connect is the "Not A Career Fair" of career fairs:

No speakers - no lectures - just come meet the Bay Area biotech companies

Some companies will be hiring, this is an opportunity to make contacts and learn more.


RSVP at http://bioeng.berkeley.edu/event/networking-with-industry


A few attending companies:

Amyris, Bayer, BD Biosciences, Bio-Rad, Boehringer Ingelheim, Bolt Threads, Clara Foods, iRhythm, NextBiotics, Janssen Pharmaceuticals, Proteus Digital Health, Senti Bio, Synvivia, Varian Medical Systems, and MORE!


Hosted by the Department of Bioengineering and the Bioengineering Honor Society

CITRIS Foundry Fellowship

Become a CITRIS Foundry Fellow and work with founders on technology that matters.


Foundry Fellows are a select group of UC Berkeley engineering and MBA students who work with founders at CITRIS Foundry, the deep technology startup accelerator based at UC Berkeley.


Join us for a meet and greet with our founders on Monday, Feb. 12th from 5-7 PM in the new CITRIS Foundry Entrepreneurship Hub in Sutardja Dai Hall. Register here.


Applications for spring 2018 are due at 11:59 PM on Thursday, Feb. 15th. Apply here.

Frontier Innovation Awards

There are hundreds of ideas, plans being made, lines of code being written and businesses forming around the disruptive technology we all call blockchain.


Who are these people? Where are they? And what problems are they solving?


We aim to find out at the first annual Frontier Innovation Awards.


CalFounders and Bee Partners are rewarding the most innovative emerging blockchain startups. This accelerator-event series-competition will culminate in an Awards Night where the winning team will be granted a Bee Partners’ term sheet and mentorship from the keynote speaker, Monero’s Riccardo ‘fluffypony’ Spagni, and his newly formed team.


Any team with a blockchain startup idea or at least one team member with a Cal affiliation can apply. Applications will be available February 6th. The application deadline is February 28.


If you have any questions, please contact us at info@frontierinnovation.vc
